intro: Phacelia leucophylla var. compacta, commonly known as the compact phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit. The plant produces showy blue to violet flowers that bloom in the spring and early summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands and rocky areas.
